thread.title: Holtby's 26 saves lift Capitals to 4-1 win over Blackhawks
thread.title_full: Holtby's 26 saves lift Capitals to 4-1 win over Blackhawks

title: Holtby's 26 saves lift Capitals to 4-1 win over Blackhawks
text:
Holtby's 26 saves lift Capitals to 4-1 win over Blackhawks The Capitals beat the punchless Chicago Blackhawks 4-1 on Thursday night. Post to Facebook Holtby's 26 saves lift Capitals to 4-1 win over Blackhawks The Capitals beat the punchless Chicago Blackhawks 4-1 on Thursday night.  //on.wusa9.com/1LwBM99   Join the Conversation To   Holtby's 26 saves lift Capitals to 4-1 win over Blackhawks Associated Press, AP 9:44 p.m. EDT October 15, 2015 Oct 15, 2015; Washington, DC, USA; Washington Capitals goalie Braden Holtby (70) makes a save on Chicago Blackhawks center Marcus Kruger (16) in the second period at Verizon Center. Mandatory Credit: Geoff Burke-USA TODAY Sports (Photo: Geoff Burke, Geoff Burke-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
WASHINGTON (AP) - Braden Holtby stopped 26 shots, Alex Ovechkin scored a goal in his return to the Washington lineup and the Capitals beat the punchless Chicago Blackhawks 4-1 on Thursday night. 
John Carlson, T.J. Oshie and Matt Niskanen also scored the Capitals, who welcomed back Ovechkin following a one-game disciplinary absence. 
Coming off a 3-0 loss to Philadelphia one night earlier, the Blackhawks trailed by three goals in this one before Viktor Svedberg got his first goal of the season at 3:13 of the third period. That ended a scoreless drought of 107 minutes, 46 seconds for the defending Stanley Cup champions. 
Ovechkin sealed the victory at 14:18, scoring from the left side of the net after a back-and-forth with teammate Evgeny Kuznetsov. 
Ovechkin was benched Tuesday night in Washington's 5-0 loss to San Jose after missing practice that morning. He said he overslept after accidentally setting his alarm for 8:30 p.m. instead of 8:30 a.m. CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE
